title:
In their advertising, businesses nowadays usually emphasise that their products are new in some way

Why is this? Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
content:
In today's modern world, major companies use adverts to promote their products in a new way. In my opinion, I consider that design and slogans play a major role to attract many consumers and they have a positive impact on the profit of enterprises.

One reason is that some businesses work so hard to promote their products or services to a large number of customers in a new method in order to increase their profits. In other words, the main purpose of companies is soaring their sales by promoting their products with a unique design that includes a specific colour in order to attract more customers. They prefer to see something stylish since some aspects of modern life are tedious. The sales consequently will increase gradually.

Another compelling reason why some businesses choose to advertise their services with a new strategy is that they focus more on a large number of people as soon as to buy their products than others for the same purposes. That is to say, nowadays, major companies offer many employment prospects in the marketing field as soon as to come up with subtle slogans that can attract consumers to purchase their products. They choose a slogan that is  amazing and it attracts the attention of consumers everywhere and anytime. For example, a taxi driver can be attracted by a nice and simple slogan even if he does not see the adverts of the product on television or on social media.

Finally, in my view, I think that individuals support companies that advertise their products in a new and attractive approach. When enterprises do a lot of efforts to reach the majority of the community, they will encourage and impulse people to buy their products significantly. Using new formats to promote products as a result brings more financial outcomes for companies.

In conclusion, offering their products in a new way by altering their designs and slogans are definitely advantageous for the purpose of lifting up the profit of the companies and attracting many customers. Businesses should work on the design and slogan of their products because consumers appreciate  creativity.

title:
Nowadays more and more people have access to the Internet. But constant availability of any information worsens people's memory and critical thinking skills.

    To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
In this cutting-edge technological era, the internet is being used by a lot of individuals. However easy access has made analytical minds disappear although it also helps make tasks easier. I will elaborate on this in forthcoming paragraphs.

To begin with, there are many drawbacks to the Internet. People who use the internet are becoming dependent upon it. There are many platforms where solutions could be found for almost any situation. What one needs to do is just put some keywords and information would appear on the screen. So commuters do not need to make any research they can just copy the answer and paste it anywhere. For instance, chat GPT is an online platform which can leave many workers jobless in the future as teachers are being replaced by the internet.

Moving to the benefits of the internet, it has made life easier. Information about almost everything is available just a click away. No one needs to study for hours to get to the conclusion. There are simple ways to solve problems, so no need to go to the traditional routes or formulae. For example, tasks could be done just by putting the equation and the answer will be there just in seconds or less, if asked what is pie, the web will show results and tell the source behind it.

To conclude, there are indeed detrimental to almost everything. While the relief that is provided can not be replaced. The Internet is and reliable way to find data about anything. It has made many jobs less stressful.

title: People are living longer. Some people think that it causes big problems. Others, however, think the ageing population has many advantages for business, government and for society in general. Discuss both views & give your own opinion
content:
Due to the consecutive development of the standard of living, an average person’s lifespan is lengthened. However, it has led to the state of an ageing population which is considered either to cause issues for authorities or to benefit the society. In my opinion, I strongly agree that the disadvantages outweigh the advantages of having an ageing citizen and through this essay, I will analyse the reasons for this assertion.  

To begin with, a shortage in the young label force could be seen as one of the gravest drawbacks to a country owning an ageing community. The dramatic decrease in the number of young dwellers has resulted in a reduction in the total of newborn babies per year. Alongside that, the elderly tend to avoid giving birth to an infant because their body can not accommodate the conditions of bearing a foetus. Therefore, there will be fewer options for the recruitment agency. Following that, the deficiency of new workers will deteriorate the country’s economy. As industries require many employees with youthful strength and commitment to serve the needs of humanity. For instance, the service industry demands an immense volume of workers to operate.

Besides, the ageing population also pressurises the economy with a tremendous amount of retirement pensions. As mentioned above, there are not enough staff which means that there will be no profits for the country’s income. The potential of a country is evaluated through their workforce and economic sustainability. Not only in a shortage of money and being unable to pay for the social welfare but the nation also can not call for foreign investments. Therefore, the opportunities for country innovation in every area will decline without the help of other nations.

In a nutshell, I believe that the drawbacks of an ageing population surpass the advantages of the effect of the old-aged workforce and the burden on the country’s economy.

title: In many part of the world, children are given more freedom than in the past. Is this a positive or negative development?
content:
Nowadays, in many societies, the youth have access to more freedom compared to the past. Whilst there are some drawbacks associated with this availability, I believe the main benefits are more substantial.

On one hand, the primary advantage of having more freedom is that giving permission utilizing up-to-the-minute gadgets leads to the privilege of having access to higher education sources and reinforcing their knowledge. In addition, having access to technology not only provides teenagers with a wide range of information to enhance their knowledge but also plays an important role in order to find their passion for a specific subject which can be their future job. For example, some channels on YouTube can be highly beneficial for children to learn more about a particular subject which used to be unavailable. A further benefit of freedom is that the youngsters have the opportunity to express their opinions which brings about a greater development in their personalities and more self-confidence as well. For instance, children who have been asked about their ideas feel more invaluable and have a chance to accelerate their maturity process.

On the other hand, giving freedom excessively can give rise to facing major problems. One disadvantage of freedom is that youngsters are more likely to be threatened by consuming cigarettes or other harmful drugs. Therefore, parents should allocate their children and raise their awareness about the detrimental effects of these behaviours. Another negative point of giving freedom is that teenagers can be prone to some dangerous tasks which can bring about vital issues. For example, being allowed to drive under the legal age may be prone for society.

On balance, it is true that giving freedom would seem disadvantageous under certain circumstances. However, in my view, its positive influences in terms of access to greater education and boosting their self-confidence outweigh the disadvantages.

title:
Some children spen hours every day on their smartphones. 

Why is this the case? Do you think this is a positive or a negative development?
content:
In today’s world, the use of smartphones is very common, particularly among the young generation. Spending many hours on mobile phones has become a daily routine for some children. In my view, this is concerning and can be deemed a negative development due to the lack of creativity and potential hindrance in brain development. This essay will explore the reasons behind this case.

Nowadays, smartphones play an important role in people's lives. They serve not only as tools of communication but also as channels for online exploration. The perspectives on using phones freely vary depending on families and situations. Some parents might give permission to their kids for study purposes only because they could use the internet to find unlimited knowledge regardless of going to school. Others may allow phone usage for entertainment, such as watching cartoons on Youtube, as they believe it helps with relaxation.

From my perspective, it is essential to recognize the potential drawbacks associated with uncontrolled phone usage. One significant issue is that when children spend more time on phones than going out to play with friends, they may lose social skills, which can lead to problems in their adulthood. Another adverse effect is that excessive phone use might cause health problems. Numerous studies suggest that prolonged screen time can directly impact concentration and memorization, especially in the younger generation who are increasingly reliant on smartphones.

In conclusion, excessive focus on screens every day can lead to adverse consequences for children. As a result, using smartphones for specific purposes should be allowed and monitored by parents to ensure their kids spend time online in an appropriate way.

title: some people believe that it is good to share as much information as possible in scientific research, business and the academic world. Others believe that some infomation is too important or too valueable to be shared freely.
content:
There are different opinions on whether to share free information related to scientific research, business and the academic world or consider such information too crucial for sharing. This essay will elaborate on both sides of this debate before explaining why I believe that not all information should be accessible to everyone.

On the one hand, some people believe that information should be available to the masses. Sharing research results can improve the speed of innovations. For example, having discovered a new method of some disease treatment, scientists may involve funds for further investigations. Furthermore, spreading valuable information ought to broaden one’s horizons. The availability of information causes people’s awareness and increases their knowledge. Take for example public libraries, where people can gain access to a lot of information.

On the other hand, individuals think that some data can lead to harmful repercussions for society. Spreading the information potentially may result in using it with bad intentions. Moreover, research findings in areas such as physics or chemistry could be used to create weapons that can threaten people’s well-being or lives. Also, distributing specific information may violate the intellectual property of people or companies and can even lead to responsibility before the law. For example, a company can lose a considerable amount of money because of a leak of commercial information.

In conclusion, while people may vary in their opinions, I think that some information can be profitable and helpful for people. However, it also can be dangerous. So, information is influential and should be shared carefully with the public.

title: Nowadays many people travel to foreign countries for pleasure. Some believe this travel has a negative impact on the countries travelled to.To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
Nowadays, there is an increasing number of tourists who visit foreign countries to get  relaxation. However, it is argued that travelling has negative influences on that particular area. I completely agree with this point of view because it may lead to crime and pollution of that destination.

The large number of tourists may cause a crime. It is undeniable that travellers bring  benefits to some particular countries. Since sightseers spend a considerable amount of money at the time of travelling, it could lead to an increase in the local businesses` income. But despite this fact, due to the throng of visitors in the bustling areas, there is a high chance for pickpockets to steal tourists` belongings elusively. This should be controlled with the help of the military or artificial intelligence otherwise their businesses will break down soon.

In addition, such a large volume of trippers can cause environmental problems to fragile habitats and historical sites. As holidaymakers may generate a massive amount of rubbish during the trip, disposal of this produced waste can be a challenging task for locals. Moreover, the mismanagement of litter can have a negative impact on the biosphere of that state. To illustrate,  Thailand has failed to mitigate water pollution and protect the natural environment due to the soaring amount of plastic rubbish left after the visit of tourists. 

In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, I totally agree that travellers from overseas are causing  damage to the destination travelled to. For one thing, an increasing number of visitors can create a crime, for another the environment may be altered and polluted by human beings.

title:
Education should be free to all people and

should be paid for and managed by the

government Do you agree or disagree with this

statement..
content:
It is undeniable that education plays an important role in people's lives , so according to some, education ought to be free of cost for society and some money should be allotted by the government to education and its management should be done by the state. In my opinion, offering everyone free education by the government would be problematic due to the heavy pressure on the government's shoulders and its bad effects on the efforts of students.

One of the reasons is that abolishing educational fees at all levels would put a tremendous burden on the suffering economy of most  countries around the world, especially developing countries. This means that developing countries have been struggling with fundamental issues, which are more crucial than literacy, and thus allocating some heavy financial aid to educational facilities would reduce the money for tackling  more essential problems including poverty, unemployment and the high rate of infectious diseases. For example, providing free education for people who are suffering from dangerous illnesses in underprivileged regions would not be advantageous for them.

Another important factor to consider is that eliminating educational fees in all grades might decrease the motivation of students. In other words, because of providing free of cost education regardless of students' scores, students would not be incentivised to work hard for better scores or take their studies seriously. Since free elementary, secondary and higher education are guaranteed for all pupils by the state, they are not motivated to put their whole heart into learning their lessons and be the best student for getting scholarships. For instance, the majority of young adults are trying to study hard and get full marks in university exams to be funded by famous British universities.

In conclusion, managing and providing educational materials and facilities freely would be problematic due to its financial aspects for most regions and decreasing level of motivation among students.

title:
In spite of the advances made in agriculture, many people around the world still go hungry.

Why is this the case?

What can be done about this problem?
content:
It has been argued that many social members from all over the planet still do not have enough food despite the developments that have been made in agriculture. This phenomenon occurred because of the unpredicted rise in world population, however, there are steps that can be taken to overcome this issue and the most effective one is making a trust-worthy prognostication by means of AI and data science.

Nowadays, it is easier to raise kids compared to the old times. In addition, there are many places that are designed to take care of children or educate them when they are seven or older. That is the reason why couples find having two or three kids, worry-free and less risky. They can rely on these organizations for further assistance and bring up new family members and also work at the same time. In this way, having better circumstances to raise children has led to population growth.

Presently, we are facing a boom in technology evolution and the best example of this is Artificial Intelligence. Furthermore, there are servers which are capable of processing huge amounts of data and producing accurate results. So, by using the help of these modern options, we can train the population model on previous years' data and also predict its probable growth due to various factors, in the near future. Finally, having a point of view on how things will change can help us make better plans.

To sum up, the problem of hunger in spite of the growth in agriculture is caused by making a false assumption and it is likely to be solved by using the maximum accuracy when we decide to make future plans.

title: as well as making money businesses also have aresponsibility towards society. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
It is believed that rather than focusing only on gaining profit, organisations should contribute and should adhere to corporate responsibility towards the community. I completely agree with the aforementioned notion and the reasons will be discussed in the upcoming paragraphs.

To begin with, there are a plethora of causes for the agreement with the above-asserted statement. In the modern era, big companies generally focus only on piling up money. However, they do not provide quality in return to the individuals. To be more precise, these corporations gain success only because of the public and once they get successful they forget to provide good quality  and authentic products in a race to earn heaps of money. Therefore, they should be involved in socio-economic activities. It is also essential for them to earn profit in order to run their business in an adequate manner.

Probing further, as these companies earn a large amount of money, they can help to eradicate poverty from society. In other words, these huge companies can provide employment to individuals and should help them financially by giving an appropriate amount of salary according to their work. While a company is financially stable, it should be indulged in charitable social activities .For instance, during the corona pandemic, tata company supported their employees by providing them with adequate amounts for their survival in that challenging situation. 

In conclusion, I would like to reiterate that although it is necessary for a company to earn money to manage their livelihood, they should provide people with desired quality  according to the price and help the community through donation practices.

title: In some areas of US , a curfew is imposed in which teenagers are not allowed to be out of doors after a particular time at night unless they are accompanied by an adult.What is your opinion about this?
content:
The imposition of curfew in certain areas of the United States does not allow youth to spend time outside at night unless they move out with an elder. It sparked a debate regarding its necessity and effectiveness . I firmly disagree with this notion. My viewpoints along with some reasons will be discussed in the upcoming paragraphs.

To begin with, enforcing a curfew on youngsters restrict their personal freedom and curtails their ability to broaden their horizon. They should be given the freedom to discover their interests and independence. For example,  a teenager with a passion for music may be a part of the band and they mostly perform at  night. Thus, imposing a curfew can limit their approaches and  prevent them from sharing their talent in the community.

Probing further, curfew often fails to address the root cause of juvenile delinquency.It is not certain that most of the crimes  are contrived at  night, they are even performed in the daytime. So, restricting the movement of teenagers is not the solution , it would rather make them more aggressive by not letting them  enjoy their teenage lives. Therefore, it will force them to do illegal activities and break the law to do  things in their interest.

In conclusion, I would like to reiterate that although the  laws and norms are applied for the betterment of citizens, the root causes and the consequences should be kept in mind . Hence, it is not a law which should be  enforced on youngsters

title: People should look after their health as a duty to the society where they live, rather than for their own benefits. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
It is true that some people think we should be responsible for taking care of our own health as a duty to society, whereas others consider that maintaining our fitness is just for our own good. Personally, I believe that both criteria should be given equal consideration. 

On the one hand, if we underestimate the importance of having good health, it might create a burden on the community. To be more specific, having an unhealthy body might lead to a variety of diseases, and people need to go to the hospital for treatment which sometimes occupies a lot of social resources, especially in countries that provide great social welfare. People might need to pay more tax due to the problems mentioned above. 

On the other hand, we can get several benefits by maintaining a healthy body. First of all, people who have good health do not need medication and they could save a lot of money. Secondly, with a healthy body, people could be more productive at work which is definitely an essential factor in one’s career. Last but not least, when we talk about well-being, it is not only physical but also mental. Lots of research has shown the importance of our mental health. People with great mental health could live a longer and more positive life. 

In conclusion, while taking good care of one’s health could regard as a duty to the society where we live, it could also help people to improve their life quality. So it’s a win-win situation to maintain a healthy body for all of us.

title:
The private car has greatly improved individual freedom of movement and has become a status symbol for many people. Yet the use of private cars has contributed to some of today's most serious problems.

How can the use of private cars be reduced?
content:
Nowadays owning a car provides you with a lot more freedom due to the fact that you can travel anywhere without experiencing the excessive extra stops public transport offers. some people also view it as a status symbol, especially when you own a German one as they are very exclusive and really expensive. Nevertheless, private automobiles have been the cause of many environmental issues globally, and so, this essay will discuss a couple of solutions that could be implemented to reverse this problem. 

Daily usage of millions of cars brings about environmental issues such as air pollution contributing to breathing problems. Additionally, it also eventually thins out the ozone layer allowing harmful UV rays to enter the atmosphere causing skin cancer. To combat this, firstly, tax zone areas should be implemented in places that have a lot of congestion such as city centres, for instance. The more the public is taxed the less they are inclined to use their cars. 

weight gain is also a problem that comes about from the excessive use of cars. Many citizens that drive everywhere put on weight quicker, America, for example, is one of the nations that have the most morbidly obese residents worldwide. Therefore, I believe if more cities have pedestrian zones, the public would exercise passively as more local attractions would be easily accessible. Thirdly, carbon-free travel, such as trams which run on electricity, contribute to no pollution, will be an excellent addition to public transportation. 

In conclusion, governmental authorities should implement a couple of these easy fixes right away as they would greatly impact the global environment and even people's health positively.

title:
In the future, nobody will buy printed newspapers or books because they will be able to read everything they want online without paying.

To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
content:
The appearance of internet service is a topical issue in the present world. The majority of people argue that  the existence of online viewers allows free them to read everything instead of purchasing paper-based media. I partly support this opinion.

Indubitably, there are several measures why printed media is continuously popular among dwellers in the future. Foremost, interpreters can interpret attractive articles by journals which concentrate to announce dominant issues in their countries. Moreover, lots of companies in relation to the news have experts on checking the information and correcting proper words. As a result, subscribers easily allow main issues without fake and wrong delivery. Apart from that, online reading needs to connect with the network to access the internet to read.

On the flip side, applying online services is beneficial to users and it will be the dominant media a few years later. Firstly, residents do not need to bring heavy items whenever they go outside. To be precise, they bring smart devices which are light and it requires the only a network to enter  online. For instance, they can bring more stuff when they go to cafes and other places since they have more space to keep their items. Besides, the internet gives us the possibility to download our ancestor's writing because most of them have already been copied by libraries which is hard to find original books.

In a nutshell, although it demonstrates numerous reasons why some people still advocate paper media, I am personally of the view that digital media will be dominant in the future.

title:
In some countries, people live with their parents and siblings until their old age. Do you think there are more advantages or disadvantages to this behaviour? 

Discuss your opinion and provide specific reasons and

examples to support your answer.
content:
Nowadays the world has changed tremendously from the past ,but some people remain with their traditions. In certain cities, one has the option to stay with their legal guardians, brothers and sister for  years. I think that anyone can live with their parents until they reach a certain age that they should move out of their house. 

     On the one hand, there are multiple advantages for someone to live at their parent's home. First, living at their parent's house with children ,especially grandchildren often makes them happy. Moreover, when living away from their parents' house  makes them feel sad because they might feel they will not see you again. Second, grandparents teach their grandchildren  past traditions. For example, some elderly in the middle east teach their kids how  life was in the past and how they adapted to it. Finally, this may also help the parents if they are ill. Nevertheless, when others learn that this country's civilians live with their parents for this reason this will boost their reputation.  

   However, on the other hand, there are disadvantages to this case. Firstly, living with siblings may result in conflicts happening between them. In some ,countries statistics have shown that the number one factor to divorce is family issues. lastly, living with parents will not let individuals depend on themselves. Not only will this ruin the idea of people not being dependable but also not having the responsibility to do a task. If a person is not responsible it would make him not trusted within his community. 

   In conclusion, there are several advantages to individuals living with their parents, however, there are also disadvantages to it.

title: It is often considered that change is more beneficial to people than trying to avoid it and have everything remain the same. Do you think the advantages of change outweigh the disadvantages?
content:
Many people believe that transition adds enormous value to their lives, but others refuse to change and prefer to stay the same. Although change may be unsettling for some, I consider the benefits of personal growth that generated by change exceed any disadvantages.

On the one hand, People resist change because their minds are used to certain circumstances. This means that people grow up with certain experiences and cultures. As a result, they form certain behaviours and beliefs. This makes it difficult for people to embrace change since it causes discomfort or undesired tension. For example, it is extremely difficult for an obese person to involve any change in their lifestyle. Moreover, even slight adjustments cause them give up and anxiety. However, I believe that a stronger support system can assist individuals to get over this issue and embrace the benefits of change.

On the other hand, The advantage of change is that it brings growth into life. Either can be personal growth or professional growth. It makes people happy when they see them improving in certain aspects of life. People push their discomfort to see new boundaries, which allows them to see life differently. As an illustration, I used to start an occupation that I had never done before. I was hesitant in the early stages, but eventually, I slowly adapted and accepted the role change. As a result, it brings to tremendous growth on a personal and professional level. Therefore, it is possible to draw a direct correlation between change and happiness.

In conclusion, people refuse growth because of the fear or anxiety they experience, but I once again restate that the benefits of embracing change outweigh the risks when we see how it adds to our happiness and fulfillment.

title: Everyone should stay at school until 18. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
It is said that all students should stay at school until the age of eighteen. Although staying at school until adulthood can bring  enormous benefits, I still disagree with this idea for many reasons, which will be outlined in this essay.

   To begin with, children should continue to study at school until the age of eighteen does have several certain advantages. Firstly, there is a major group of young people, who is less than eighteen years old, have very little practical experience and have very little intention of what goals they will direct. Consequently, staying at school until mature age will help them have a suitable environment to develop their education and time to think about their future career path. Moreover, compelling candidates to stay at the institute until eighteen will create a better-educated future generation of people, which may assist to reduce social problems and unemployment rates.

    However, there is the figure of drawbacks that makes me disagree with this idea. It can be seen that many children these days do not fit in with the common education system and forcing them to remain at school can cause some problems. For example, these kinds of students are usually very disruptive in a classroom and this affects other students who are striving for study. Additionally, most students many children choose to follow careers that do not require them to continue studying in school past the age of sixteen. For instance, for those who wish to follow a career that requires more practical-based learning, such as a qualified builder, electrician, or machinery operator, it is quite unnecessary to remain at school until the age of eighteen.

    In conclusion, although there are many beneficial advantages for children remaining at school until adulthood. In my view, I personally feel that the drawbacks outweigh the positives mentioned above.

title: Some people believe that children’s leisure activities must be educational, otherwise they are a complete waste of time. Do you agree or disagree? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your experience.
content:
The question of whether children’s leisure activities must be educational has sparked heated debate. Some regard that all events should have their aim or purpose, while others see entertaining events as also beneficial. I personally contend with the idea that leisure activities for kids are not necessarily educational, and other events are also meaningful. In this essay, I will elaborate reasons in more detail and provide my personal experience.

First of all, educational events with certain purposes usually bring pressure and can be easily observed. When parents and educators intentionally required students to participate in some particular activities, they become unwilling to cooperate and tend to lose their motivation and curiosity on certain topics. Since, it is their nature that people hate to be forced to do something and so are youngsters, thus, planned events with some goals consistently backfired and ultimately killed the possibility for them.

On the other hand, facts are proven that non-educational events can also result in educational values. Playing basketball, for instance, is seen as a mere recreational sport. However, it is well-known that individuals who joined basketball teams have performed better leadership, negotiation skills and teamwork ability. This is because when a team is playing to win, it grows related skills mentioned that equipped themselves, and makes them capable of winning. Therefore, we can end up learning from those events who regards as only complete waste of time.

Regarding my personal experiences, while often seen as a recreational activity, watching America TV shows (such as Friends) has brought unthinkable positive effects on me. Indulging in beloved dramas, my English improved to the next level since I was more familiar with its pronunciation and sentence structure. Surprisingly, it was events without a purpose that benefited me.

In conclusion, educational events do not always reach their original goals, and possibly cased opposite outcomes. Additionally, entertainment can otherwise provide valuable educational achievements. Therefore, activities for teens should not be detailly planned, and certainly shall not always be educational.

title:
Governments should spend money on railways rather than roads.

To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
content:
There have been many controversial arguments surrounding investing in railways or roads for the better. But instead of choosing one, I decide to choose both. In fact, if the government decides to allocate both, we will have lots of advantages for the entire nation.

For starters, railways are a meaningful invention that the ancients made. On average, the volume that trains can carry up to 300 tons of category, is beneficial to everyone. Railways capacity is more significant. Despite transporting people and goods as a huge mass, it still saves energy when running compared to other vehicles reducing environmental pollution. Regarding speed, rail lines facilitate faster transporting/ transportation. In the modern century, commerce sites connecting every means of transport are very popular therefore when people place an order, they tend to want it delivered today. The train line is a good choice for freight. Besides, since the train uses separate lanes, the problems to do with a high volume of traffic will be rectified and avoid unexpected crashes. According to lots of citizens’ perspectives, it’s safer and cheaper when we use railways. 

Next is roadways that have many advantages nothing less than railways. For starters, people are used to using roads, so investment in roads should be paid more attention. Streets are maintained periodically because it often has many potholes and slippery roads that are not repaired, making riders extremely nervous. Regarding the good level of happiness of the citizens, they feel contented with high-quality streets which offer them the convenience in commuting travelling time. At the same time, roadways also have flexibility. When the road is stuck, you can choose to take another route, and the locals or the map will guide you. Nowadays, if you have a problem with means of transportation, you can use the app to book the car therefore it is very convenient.

In general, spending money on both can be difficult for the national budget so there should be cooperation from private, public and environmental organizations to invest costs and reduce environmental pollution. Along with that, it is necessary for people’s awareness to speak up and discuss the issues that people want to solve from there the government will focus on solving urgent problems

In conclusion, investment in railways and roadways is a good option to provide a better transport experience for people and benefit the whole society in terms of environmental protection and safety on the road.

title: In some countries elder people are to work longer and not to retire. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of working beyond retirement age.
content:
As more and more nations age, more and more elderly are encouraged to continue working over retirement age. In my opinion, there are possible benefits and drawbacks of extending individual working life.

On the positive side, working beyond retirement age can be beneficial in the following aspects. Firstly, continuing work improves the elderly's financial condition. More years in the job mean more experience, which in turn means more revenue. For skilled jobs, such as doctors, engineers and professors, people approaching retirement age tend to have rich experience and are also in the highest income period of their career. Furthermore, an elder person may find that having a job provides a sense of satisfaction. This is because people who have jobs have a sense of identity and feel they are part of society, which is necessary to maintain a good mental state. Not only that, but the active movement a job provides could help keep one’s body healthy. As physical exercise is important for everyone, especially for the elderly.

However, there are possible influences if people work after the average expected years. Obviously, it could damage their health condition. The older a human is, the more rest they need. When the elders do not get enough time to recover, it will pose a huge burden on  their bodies, leading to a series of physical problems, even death. Another disadvantage is that the interpersonal relationship can be affected. After investing so many years of one’s life into a career, they deserve a life of leisure and family happiness. If they are still occupied with a job, there will be less time to do what they love to do and enjoy with their family. In that case, some of them may develop a lonely lifestyle. 

In conclusion, there are benefits and risks to motivating old people to continue their careers. It could maintain health and acquire a sense of fulfilment, meanwhile, it could also result in more exhaustion and solitude. For those who continue to work beyond retirement age, it may be helpful to replace manual work with mental work as much as possible.

title: Music play an important role in society, others think it is simply a form of entertainment for individuals. Discuss both views and give your opinion
content:
Nowadays, music has become predominant in societies. However, other sectors of society argue that is mere entertainment for people. In my opinion, music assumes both roles, it is a way of entertainment but also plays a critical role in societies. In this essay, I will discuss both points of view to clarify my own opinion.

To begin with, it is certain that music has been considered a way of expression but also a way of entertainment in different cultures over the centuries. For instance, every time there is a celebration, music is played, as well as people in their own houses like to listen to the radio because they feel better. However, music is much more than that. People who reduce the music only to a way to get distracted and get fun is having a very limited view of it. 

On the other hand, considering music only as an entertainment pattern would be offensive to this magnificent humankind's creation.  For instance, there are records that music exists since humankind commenced to make their firsts technological developments, in which it has been demonstrated to be a way of expression, contributing to communication with others and the organisation of rituals. In other words, neither centuries ago nor in the present, music has been created to express and communicate emotions, ideas and a sense of energy, which also had an enormous impact on the audience because of its magnificence. This is why people may confuse the purpose of music with mere entertainment, as music has always been loved by humankind.

In conclusion, music is an artistic expression that allows multiple interpretations, which also explains why some people could think that is only to get entertained, as music does not say how need to be interpreted or even understood. Although, we cannot deny that music is greater than that and we need to put it in the right place that truly deserves inside the society. Music is critical for our lives.

title:
Some think that a country’s success is completely dependent on economic progress while others believe that other factors are also important. 

What are the different factors contributing to the success of a country? 

Do you believe that one factor is more important than others?
content:
It is argued by some individuals that economic progress is one of the main contributing factors to the country’s success. Although economic progress is one of the criteria for the nation’s success, I believe the social progress index should also be considered. 

On the one hand, the growth of the economy is the main criterion that makes a country become great. The measurement of economic progress is GDP (growth domestic product) or the amount a country earns. America is one   example of a country which has high GDP index based on the world bank, and this nation also considers a top five successful country due to being one of the highest-income nations in the world. In addition, an unemployment rate includes a progressive economic rate in a country. When people have a job, they can afford their basic needs such as meals, accommodation, and bills. The less of the unemployment rate is, the more successful a nation is. The UK is one of the countries that has the lowest unemployment rate so  this country is one of the successful countries based on economic growth criteria.

On the other hand, social index progress is an important factor that should be considered to assess a country’s success. The social index progress includes how the countries serve their populations, human rights, access to education and health, and a fair law system. For instance, Denmark and New Zealand are two countries that consider to be successful countries based on  social criteria. Both countries treat their citizens really well. Populations in Denmark feel happy because of the measurement of social index progress; the employees feel satisfied with their work because their rights are fulfilled whether right as an employee or as a citizen in Denmark. It is also known that the index of worker turnover in Denmark is low. Although the GDP rate in Denmark is far less than in America and the UK, the index of happiness in this country is the highest among other countries around the world. This means social index progress is the far pivotal criterion to make a country great.           

To sum up, while economic factors are the criteria that make successful countries, I believe that based on the citizen perspective social factors are more significant in terms of a progressive country.

title:
Traffic and accomodation problems are increasing and government should encourage some businesses to move from cities to rural areas. Do the advantages outweigh the

 disadvantages?
content:
The increasing number of vehicles and housing problems have caused officials to motivate businesses to relocate from major cities to the countryside. Whilst acknowledging that there are drawbacks, this essay will argue that the advantages of this change will outweigh the disadvantages.

To begin with, the predominant advantage of the moving away of companies is definitely the development of the countryside. To further explain this, the relocation of major companies to the countryside is going to increase the labour force which would in turn help in economic growth leading to more education and employment opportunities, hence causing the rural areas to develop. Another major advantage of the relocation of businesses would be reduced pollution levels in major cities. With the reverse migration to rural areas, there would be a reduced number of automobiles leading to less carbon footprint and decreasing greenhouse effect. For instance, The major city in India, Delhi, is ranked as the most polluted city in the country, because of  overpopulation and huge traffic problems. Thus, the economic and environmental aspect of the relocation of businesses is highly advantageous.

While the aforementioned pros, there are several negative aspects to this that still need to be considered. One of the biggest drawbacks is the cost and time it would require to travel to work. People who live in the centre would now have to change their lifestyle and commute almost 30 to 40 kilometres every day to the job which would require not only plenty of time but also would cost a lot of money too, leading to elevated stress levels. For example, a research study done by  Harvard University showed that stress levels were more in an individual whose work was far away from home as compared to the one who loved nearby his job. 

To conclude, Although there are numerous benefits and drawbacks of moving businesses to the rural side at the same time,  the economic and  environmental benefits of the relocation of businesses are tremendous. Hence, the positive effects of  moving companies away definitely outweigh the negative ones.

title:

On the contrary, many people oppose the above-mentioned statement for many reasons, individuals believe that if they start their children's schooling late then children waste their time at home. In addition, children's interests may be diverted to some other activities. 

To recapitulate, according to the arguments aforementioned above. One can reach the conclusion that the benefits of  late schooling are indeed too great to ignore.

title: Some species of animals are almost extinct; and many others seem to be fast approaching a similar risk. What are the reasons for this? What should be done to solve this problem.
content:
Nowadays, the issue of worldwide animal extinction has become a strongly debated topic. A wide range of species almost disappeared completely in the past few decades, while many others are close enough to do the same. This is due to the enormously increased human activity in their habitats. In my essay, I am going to reveal the reasons behind this, and I try to suggest some solutions as well.

The biggest reason behind disappearing most of these animals is hunting. For instance, in some Asian countries buying a tooth of a tiger on the black market is a very popular habit. This leads to the fact, that the illegal hunting of tigers is growing continuously. In addition, many other species are in danger related to global climate change. For example, the living area of polar bears is decreasing dramatically due to the melting of icebergs at the North Pole.

As long as the most likely reason for animal extinction is the human impact on their habitats, the solution must be also developed by us. According to hunting, the government should give a strong response, like a prison sentence for those, who hunt tigers illegally. Furthermore, reducing the emission of carbon dioxide can be effective to decrease global warming. This might result in the growth of the living area of polar bears again.

In conclusion, human impact on wildlife has caused the extinction of some species. Both overhunting and global warming have serious effects on wildlife diversity. I strongly hope that mankind can solve these issues as soon as possible before it turns too late.

title: Some countries have become much richer than others. Richer countries should now help poorer countries. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
content:
Numerous nations are becoming more affluent these days, whereas impoverished countries are getting worse. To tackle this, some suggest that it is vital to help low-income nations. I believe that the idea of supporting poorer nations is morally right and will reduce global challenges, including international migration. 

One leading cause why giving monetary aid to poorer nations is that it is morally right. Because rich countries can afford to support people in distressed regions, it could be ethically wrong not to help suffering nations who lack basics such as food, water and medicine. This is particularly important during difficult times when high inflation and food crises impact disproportionately poorer countries. 

Additionally, another primary reason why helping poorer nations is that it can contribute to the reduction of international migration. Factors such as lack of shelter, food and other essentials contribute to the increase of people escaping from their well-off countries to wealthier nations in search of a better life. Therefore, providing these nations with financial support in their homeland is crucial. 

However, it is also necessary that poorer nations take the initiative to improve their situations. In the long term, monetary assistance from Western countries is not sustainable because they will not be able to support other countries persistently in the long run. Authorities in poorer nations should, for instance, increase the quality of their institutions and create jobs and businesses. 

To conclude, helping poorer countries is vital for different reasons, including that it can give us a greater sense of humanity, and diminish global migration, as refugees are supported in their places. However, governments in impoverished countries should engage in finding solutions for their problems and strive to create opportunities for their citizens, incorporating employment opportunities for their nationals.

title: Many students find it difficult to concentrate or pay attention at school. What are the reasons? What could be done to solve this problem?
content:
Some people argue that most students have difficulty focusing on classes. This essay will examine the main reasons for this argument and possible solutions to it.

Most of the students wake up very early for their busy schedules and feel sleepy in the first classes at school which makes it really hard to focus on any subject. Furthermore, there are generally many long and sequential course sessions, with boring and unattractive formats in general, with little breaks in between, which disables the students to recharge and energize herself/himself to get ready to learn new subjects. For instance, researchers published that teenagers' focus time is only 16 minutes, after that they got either distracted or bored. In that case, it does not make sense to hold up 40 mins sessions. In addition, technological devices such as tablets and smartphones are the top distractions, even one notification on the phone is enough to ruin the concentration of the students.

A possible solution can be a new arrangement of the time and content schedules at schools considering the new generations' challenges and advantages. Maybe arranging shorter sessions with more little breaks can help students to concentrate better. Besides, the formats of the contents might be more fun with gamification and usage of more attractive visuals and experiments if applicable. Another solution could be prohibiting smart devices throughout the learning time which blocks the possibility of being disturbed by them when focused.

In conclusion, the misarrangement of time and content format and smart devices can cause students to lose their focus, even though rearrangement of the school days and prohibiting smart devices can help the problem.

title: Some people believe that zoos are inhumane and should be closed down. Others argue that zoos play an important role in wildlife conservation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
content:
Nowadays, we have zoos all around the world to preserve endangered animals and to the purpose of introducing these animals to people. While some people think that zoos are necessary to protect wildlife animals others believe that this lifestyle is not acceptable for animals and should not be allowed. I will discuss both viewpoints and elaborate the reasons why I side with the latter opinion defending that putting animals in a small place for a lifetime is unacceptable. 

On the one hand, zoos might play an important role in protecting endangered species by providing them with essential conditions to survive. Since the biggest issue in the wild is difficulty to find food and water sources, zoos can help the animals by providing these basic needs. Furthermore, these controlled places might give a chance for treatment to animals with serious injuries and help to increase their lifetime. More than that, with controlled breeding next generations could be produced and animal genes can be preserved.

On the other hand, removing animals from their natural habitats can lead to a lot of problems such as an imbalance in nature. For instance, removing one animal from the food chain can affect all other species in the food pyramid. Therefore, as all the natural balance would be affected negatively changing the natural system should not be that easy. Besides all of these, putting an animal in a very small living place can cause a lot of behavioural disorders also. Consequently, these disorders will lead to other mental and physical conditions.

In conclusion, there are some believers that menageries are necessary to keep wild animals alive and protect their generations for long years whereas others argue that zoos are inhumane places for animals as they are way smaller than animals need and change balance of the nature. I believe animal welfare is more important than everything and the protection of endangered species can be done without changing their natural habitats. I opine zoos have gone out of their purpose and have become touristic places only. Therefore, as a veterinarian, I believe as these conditions cause more problems than help, zoos are unacceptable places for animals.

For instance, I ordered a parcel from Amazon about they added a huge amount as delivery charges because there was no store nearby.

In conclusion, Government take a good decision because it is mandatory to remove traffic and accommodation problems. Yes, there are many disadvantages to it but also the advantage for human health and air pollution.

title:
Write about the following topic.

Internet social media have become very popular. To what extent do you think this is a good or bad thing? Why do you think this is the case?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
content:
The internet is undoubtedly one of the most important inventions of this century. High-speed internet has become widely available, leading to the increased popularity of social media. Most people nowadays possess at least one social media account. While some people argue that social media might be beneficial to some extent, I do believe that the massive use of social media is detrimental to our society.

To begin with, it may be true that internet platforms may provide users with  opportunities to communicate with people around the world, enabling them to share ideas or inspiring stories. Also, in some ,people use social media for business. As we can see on Facebook feeds or Instagram posts, many young entrepreneurs advertise their original products on their social media accounts. Thus, social media indeed have advantageous effects. However, over popularity of these online platforms has created appalling effects on our society. First, loss of privacy. Teenagers and young people tend to post every activity that they do. For example, I see tons of videos and pictures that I feel are inappropriate to be posted publicly such as kissing, drinking or dancing half-naked. This, in my opinion, could exert negative consequences including crimes. 

In addition, social media could also increase consumerism. Social media is full of artists and public figures who always introduce new trends in clothing or advertise cutting-edge gadgets. Indeed, the public will feel the pressure to buy or own the advertised products, even though they do not need them at all.

In conclusion, although social media may allow  users to keep in touch with their families and friends, I believe that it has detrimental effects on our society such as loss of privacy and increase consumerism behaviour.

title: Nowadays, some employers think that formal academic qualifications are more important than life experience or personal qualities when they look for new employees. Why is it the case? To what extent do you agree or disagree?
content:
There is a controversial statement heating up a debate over the fact that some recruiters favour candidates who have formal credentials for study over those with only life experience or good personality traits in today's society. This essay will look at some causes of this and I personally do not have a consensus with this idea.

Without a shadow of a doubt, academic degrees are valued more than life experience and character by some employers when they seek new staff. Because they believe that potential employees with an excellent qualification are equipped with in-depth knowledge and useful skills which play a crucial part in their future careers. For instance, some leading technology firms, namely FPT, Vingroup and so on, highly appreciate prospective workers who have Information Technology degrees or Internet Engineering certificates, therefore an improved quality of life for candidates who take them. Hence, taking academic background as a priority in recruit procedures exerts certain virtues.

While the necessity of having a distinction degree is widely acknowledged, personalities and life experiences are vital for new hires as well. The majority of the skills needed for a job can be acquired through experience, which helps people deal with difficult situations more effectively. Take social and communication skills as two examples, these can be trained and practiced through experiencing ups and downs in life, so that it will make contributions to their jobs. Thus, it is detrimental to assess one’s working ability based merely on their academic performance.

In conclusion, although academic qualifications can have certain values, it should not be regarded as the only and the most important factor to select the best workers.

title:
Technology is being used more and more in education. Some people say that this is a positive trend, while others argue that it is leading to negative consequences.

Discuss both sides of this argument and then give your own opinion.
content:
Nowadays, it is becoming increasingly common for teachers to use technology in their classes. Some people believe that it is a positive trend, while others think that it will bring negative effects. In fact, I side with those who think that technology brings positive impacts.

On the one hand, technology helps students to improve their abilities. In the class, many materials need improved technology to make the students understand better such as science. By having technology in the class, teachers can use many creative varieties in the class. For instance, students can see the real process of photosynthesis by using improved technology. As a result, the student can achieve academic success.

On the other hand, technology can replace the teacher's position in the class. By providing technology in the class, teachers will get less interaction with the pupils. Many activities will be served with the technology. The teachers do not have to explain the material. For illustration, teachers just have to provide the video of the cells in the class without having an explanation from the beginning in front of the class. Consequently, teachers will not be the centre of the class.

To sum up, an increasing number of people using technology in class have controversy in society. Many people believe that it will make bad effects on the class such as replacing the role of the teachers. However, I am firmly convinced that having technology in the class will be helpful such as making the student understand the material better which can improve their academic success.

title: There are more workers to work from home and more students to study from home. This is because the computer technology is more and more easily accessible and cheaper. Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
content:
It is commonly argued that more workers and students work and study from home because computer technology is more and more easily accessible and cheaper. Personally, I can neither completely agree nor disagree with this statement for a variety of reasons.

I partly agree that people work and study from home is positive. One of the main reasons can be that working and studying with individual computers at home saves bulk time and money. This means that doing everything from home does not take commuting time as well as traffic fees such as vehicle tickets, and fuel. Another reason can be that using their computers at home make working and studying flexible time because computer technology is more and more easily accessible and cheaper. For example, anyone who works from home has time to work and take care of themselves.

On the other hand, I disagree with the viewpoint that doing work and studying from home is positive. Firstly,  working and studying from home does not have the opportunity to debate with their colleagues and friends. For example, those who work from home cannot meet face-to-face colleagues to discuss a problem. Secondly, using individual at home is unmanaged by the supervisor of the company make them can lose focus while working. For instance, while using the computer at home make they play more games, not work.

In conclusion, although working and studying from home with the computer is more and more easily accessible and cheaper. I am convinced that working and studying from home brings more positive and negative others.
